Title:
Notes on rust fungi in China 8. Life cycle of Pucciniastrum
tiliae and its new host plants inferred from phylogenetic evidences
Keywords:
phylogeny, Pinaceae, Pucciniastreae, Tiliaceae, tree
disease
Abstract:
Life cycle connection between spermogonial and aecial
stages on Abies holophylla and uredinial and telial stages on Tilia
mongolica and T. mandshurica collected northeast of China were confirmed
by phylogenetic analyses. These stages are identified as Pucciniastrum
tiliae with morphological observations. Life cycle of this rust fungus
is reported for the first time in China and A. holophylla and T.
mongolica are new host plants for the species.
